Experience

College of Staten Island

REU Student Researcher • 6/2017 — 8/2017

Collaborated with professor in analyzing Particle Filter algorithms that are used for detecting the location of a moving or stationary object.

Projects

donutfinder.io

Founder & Primary Developer • 2012 — Present

Donut Locator is an open source node/ember app that lets users find donuts within a defined radius from their home.

Springfield Donut Eater's User Group

Co-Founder & Organizer • 2007 — Present

DEUG is a local monthly meetup in Springfield where we share all the latest tips and tricks for dat donut lifestyle. I organize the group, and typically eat most of the donuts.

Club Affiliations

Tau Beta Pi

Member • Spring 2016 ~ Present

The Honors Engineering Society where passionate students are given opportunities to network and socialize with other engineering majors.

Eta Kappa Nu

Treasurer • Spring 2017

A Computer & Electrical Engineering Honors Society where I managed the club fundings in addition to outreach and emails to build up more recognition for the club and its members.

Society of Women in Engineering

WOW! Chair • Fall 2017 ~ Spring 2018

My favorite club of all! I collaborate with SWE board members to organize our annual WOW! Event, where our goal is to encourage and inform female high school students about the plethora of opportunities in engineering. Rather then explaining, we literally show students the possibilities of engineering through hands-on workshop and talks by established female engineer leaders.

Society of Asian Scientists & Engineers

Member • Fall 2017 ~ Present

The club provides opportunities for students to attend SASE’s national conferences and meet chapters from other local colleges. The most recent event was the Intel Networking Conference where the host gathered Intel engineering and business employees to discuss their own transition from college to real-life work. Their success stories made us see the limitless potential for growth in the field and sparked a lot of inspiration for the students- including myself.

Bridging Engineering Students Transition

Mentor • Spring 2016 ~ Fall 2016

BEST’s purpose is to help freshman and sophomore engineering students transition into college and provide mentorship academically and socially. SJSU offers many amazing programs and resource centers that I wish I had known about when starting my freshman year. As a mentor, I inform my mentees about these opportunities, so they can make the most of what college has to offer.

Volunteer Work

Washington Hospital

Volunteer • 2/2013 ~ 5/2014

Assisted a diversity of patients to make their visit comfortable and learned how to integrate myself into the hospital work system.

Milpitas High School

AVID Tutor • 1/2014 ~ 6/2014

Tutored a group of 6-7 high school students with math problems and developed ways to improve their critical thinking abilities.
